content.description: very fun route and GREAT warm-up.    First moves are the crux.   Stick clip the 2nd bolt if unsure about the initial moves.
content.protection: 7-8 draws.....stick clip the second bolt for added safety. The first moves ar   e the crux!

content.description: Fun climbing through the first 5 bolts get you to a HELL of a Crux that is guaranteed to make you do awkward stuff.
content.location: TO the Right of Gogol Bordello. Furthest Right route on this wall.

content.description: Crux is first 2 bolts.   Very bouldery moves on thin holds.   Hard climbing eases off at 3rd bolt    This route is furthest left on the Nazareth Wall.
Crux is the first 3 bolts.   Using the good mono reach/jump to the 3 foot wide jug and traverse right a couple feet into some technical side-pulling action.
content.location: This route is right of Achilles on the new Mythology wall just South of Divinations cave.

content.description: Start on the ledge to the left of "gogol bordello" move up the prow to the crack on your left.    Under-cling the roof crack with your feet on the slab to clip the 3rd bolt.   Very exciting route!
content.protection: 7 bolts to Cold Shuts (shares anchors with Gogol Bordello)
content.location: To the right of Nazareth.   To the left of Gogol Bordello.   Starts on the ledge.

content.description: Crux is the first 3 bolts of reachy & thin vertical climbing on smooth black limestone.
content.location: It is the 3rd route from the left. Just left of Pliney    Look for a very thin face with a built up belay spot.

content.description: Best warm-up here. Start using the huge pockets and trend slightly right up to the vertical side pulls.
content.location: This route is the first route encountered when heading to The Mythology Wall, just before "Achilles"

content.description: Great route and the warm-up for this area.   An easier start is found by starting on the "Pliny the Elder" ledge and getting the jug to clip the 3rd bolt (kind of scary). This makes it 5.10   Just do the direct 5.11 version and you'll be glad you did.
content.location: First route you encounter.   Furthest route to the right.

content.description: An overhanging dihedral that climbs like a techy slab. Very fun movement and a great warm-up for the other areas.
content.location: This route is located West of the approach trail about 30 ft. before crossing the creek at the bridge.

content.description: Huge roof!   Crux is in between the 4th & 7th bolt,    If that's not hard enough for you there is an extension that adds another V10-ish section turning the lip of the roof.
content.protection: Fixed draws mostly. Might need 1 or 2 QD's for the start.
content.location: from the Nazareth wall head stage right about 50 ft and around the corner you will see the CAVE!

content.description: Crux is at the last bolt.   Good moves on a REALLY short climb.
content.location: This route is around the corner from the Flood Route.Access via cairned trail just before crossing the log bridge to get to the Main Beth areas.

content.description: A little more sustained than the routes on the other walls here.
content.location: This is the first of several new routes on the wall just South of Divinations.

content.description:
Bethlehem is a unique great quality black limestone area. The lack of texture on some of the faces makes for tricky face climbing.     This is a good shady crag in the morning and gets sun on the face climbs around 2 in the afternoon.   The "Divinations" cave is climbable all day and during rain. Expect to be the only climbers in the area.  

Overview
